content.description: High quality slab climb on clean solid rock.  Start as you would for My Time, but break left after 25 ft.  Use knobs to gain the first bolt of Vacationland on the face.  Follow five bolts to rap anchor.  Rap with two ropes, or do optional less classic second pitch.  Rappel with two ropes.
content.protection: Use gear (medium cams/nuts) for the My Time corner, then draws for the five bolts on the face.
content.location: Locate the beginning of My Time (right angling corner).  Locate the line of bolts on the right side of the face to the left of My Time.

content.description: Climb slab left of the corner layback of Ben's Balls passing several bolts through crux. Protection available in flakes and cracks, but avoid snake. Climb straight up to bolted anchor.
content.location: Main face: In between Reggie's Route and Crystal Dance (5.8). Right of the start for My Time and Ben's Balls.

content.description:
One of the best climbs of its grade in Clifton.  Classic face climbing on superb rock. 

  Pitch 1:  Start on the flat, grassy ledge shared with Dazed and Confused moving up and right just below the bushes to gain a crack on the right. Climb crack or face on the right to bolt anchors (50') 

  Pitch 2:  Sustained climbing straight up the knobby, white face past 5 bolts and a Tri-cam placement.  Move left through the brown streaks to a two bolt anchor (140').  Rappel the route or 4th class to the summit.
content.location: Big Chick Hill - Main Face - Right of Tower Gully

content.description: A Clifton classic! Make time for My Time - especially for the new leader, a really fun climb.P1: Follow the ramp up the corner to its top and more right to a left facing flake. This part is a little run out but just remember, its only 5.5 Layback the flake to a ledge then traverse straight right around bulge (crux) to a pin belay.P2: Move out to the right following the dike on Ben's Balls (remember to protect your second). Just before the pine tree, step up left past a bolt to a two bolt anchor on a ramp.P3: Move slightly left up to pin then trend up and right past three more bolts to a chained bolt anchor. Third class up and left to summit, walk off to trail on the right or rappel with two ropes.[ Edit Note- You might want to read the COMMENTS about P3 Â before setting out on it. R Hall, Admin. Maine]This route has a lot of potential for practicing rescue techniques due to a solid belay ledge (pitch 2) with a bomber anchor. Have fun on this one, its awesome.
content.protection: Nuts and small cams to protect the bottom, draws for bolts.
content.location: A large boulder sits to the left of the ramp.  Start at this obvious ramp between Vacationland and Ben's Balls.

content.description: A clean white slab leads to an obvious bulge where technical crimping gets you thru the crux.
content.location: Walk past My Time and locate a striking white bleached streak of leading past a long line of bolts straight up the cliff.  The route goes out of site as it passes the crux bulge.

content.description: Climb the low overhang which becomes My Time.  Once established on face, follow line of bolts straight up clean slab.  The crux is pulling the bulge near the last bolt.  After last bolt, aim up and right to finish at the Vacationland anchors.  Rap with two ropes.
content.location: Pass Overnight Sensation and keep walking to the right along bottom of Main Face.  Look up and to the left and locate large clean slab with two lines of bolts going up it.  Leading Colors is the  line of bolts on the left.  Vacationland is the line of bolts on the right.  If you get to the actual beginning of My Time, you have gone too far.

content.description: Great runout slab climbing!  Start from the same stack of blocks as Overnight Sensation.  From the stacked boulders, scramble up a small slab, and out to a 20ft long crack.    Follow the crack up and exit left, aiming for the second treeledge.  Pull over a white bulge and take a deep breath.  Pitch 2: From the middle of the tree ledge, climb up the face, clipping one bolt and top out at bolt anchors.
content.protection: A few bolts (it is possible to clip the Overnight Sensation anchors with a sling).  One bolt near the beginning of the second pitch.
content.location: Main Face, right of tower gulley.  The stacked blocks marking the beginning are about 40 ft right of the tower gulley.

content.description: The longest and best slab climbs in Clifton are found here.  The main face is bordered on the left by Tower Gully and on the right by a steeper 3rd class gully called Easy Up.  Though brushy, this route does offer an alternative ascent or descent route.  The standard descent takes the more easterly broad gully that borders the right side of the Rabbit Buttress.
